title: Pro-Tip: Assassins =/= Mages, learn the difference and start complaining about the actual problem
body:
{{champion:7}} Assassin
{{champion:84}} Assassin
{{champion:38}} Assassin
{{champion:131}} Assassin
{{champion:245}} Assassin
{{champion:60}} Assassin
{{champion:103}} Assassin
{{champion:517}} Assassin

These are not Mages, these are Assassins, these do not follow the playstyle of Mages one bit and always seem to be brought up when people complain about "broken Mages"

Mages as a class are not broken, AP Assassins are the problem and are what truly need to be looked at, unfortunately Riot seem to be completely uninspired and refuse to even imagine reworking AP items to create different options for Mages, AP Bruisers and AP Assassins like they did with AD. So until they do, start complaining about the real issue instead of calling an entire class broken because of champs that don't even fit in the class or playstyle.

technically she's a specialist...like so many problem champions in these discussions

Highly mobile with multiple dashes tends to be an assassin

long range spells and crowd control tends to be a mage

even her tactics are the specialty of an assassin:  hit and run, waiting for an opportunity to burst the opponent all at once

It's also demoralizing that she will never get changed because she is so popular, especially with the female community.

Slyas is an AP fighter (Mordekaiser) with some diver attributes with his dash-chain pull combo. (Amumu Q)

Ahri and LB are 100% AP assassins.

Else can flex between pure assassin (raw damage) or fighter (some durability) thanks to her dps and on hit healing.

LeBlanc and Elise are assassins through and through, not mages. They have some utility to peel for the carry if they themselves aren't capable of getting fed, but regardless of that, they are assassins.

Ahri is a mix of both assassin and mage, so she can go either route.

Sylas is meant to be a bruiser, but due to the current lack of AP bruiser items, he's playing assassin.

Burst mages are stuff like Lux or Veigar, who sit back and do their spells, but none of the 4 you mentioned even wants to stay back and do spells (with the exception of Glacial Ahri, but even she has the tools and capability to in and fish for targets), as their main game play consists of going in, killing someone then go out. And which class is designed to go in, kill someone then go out? Oh right, Assassins.
